title: choose-matching-criteria
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

message:

title: use-default-target-group
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

title: no-global-variables
message:
Path variables

Global variables should not be used in workflows or atomic actions meant to be shared. Instead, use a "Set Variables" activity to copy global variables to local variables within the workflow. Before exporting, simply remove the global variables so the other user can select their own. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/No-Global-Variables

title: target-account-keys
message:
Path workflow,properties,runtime_user,target_default

All atomic actions should have their account key set to "Use Target's Default Account Keys". This allows the atomic to inherit whatever account key is associated with the target provided by the parent workflow. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Account-Keys

title: choose-matching-criteria
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

This should be "Choose first with matching critera" unless you want the workflow to execute once for each matching target in the group. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Choose-Matching-Criteria

title: do-not-run-on-all-targets
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

We do not recommend checking "All Targets in this Group" as it limits your ability to define target selection criteria. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Do-Not-Run-On-All-Targets

title: execute-on-target-group
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

Workflows that are meant to be shared and require targets should use a Target Group. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Execute-On-Target-Group

title: target-selection-criteria
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

This is typically "Equals Case-Insensitive" but other operators are fine if you're doing something specific. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Selection-Criteria

title: target-specify-on-start
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

All atomic actions should have their target set to "Specify Target On Workflow Start". This allows the atomic to be more portable since the workflow using it can specify the target. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Specify-On-Start

title: use-default-target-group
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

We recommend using the "Default TargetGroup" since every SecureX orchestration tenant should have it by default. If you use your own target group, it will be created during workflow import. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Use-Default-Target-Group

title: target-account-keys
message:
Path workflow,properties

All atomic actions should have their account key set to "Use Target's Default Account Keys". This allows the atomic to inherit whatever account key is associated with the target provided by the parent workflow. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Account-Keys

title: choose-matching-criteria
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

This should be "Choose first with matching critera" unless you want the workflow to execute once for each matching target in the group. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Choose-Matching-Criteria

title: do-not-run-on-all-targets
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

We do not recommend checking "All Targets in this Group" as it limits your ability to define target selection criteria. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Do-Not-Run-On-All-Targets

title: execute-on-target-group
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

Workflows that are meant to be shared and require targets should use a Target Group. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Execute-On-Target-Group

title: target-selection-criteria
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

This is typically "Equals Case-Insensitive" but other operators are fine if you're doing something specific. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Selection-Criteria

title: target-specify-on-start
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

All atomic actions should have their target set to "Specify Target On Workflow Start". This allows the atomic to be more portable since the workflow using it can specify the target. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Specify-On-Start

title: use-default-target-group
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

We recommend using the "Default TargetGroup" since every SecureX orchestration tenant should have it by default. If you use your own target group, it will be created during workflow import. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Use-Default-Target-Group

Path workflow,properties

Every workflow needs a description of length at least 10. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Required-Description

title: required-target
message:
Path workflow,properties

Every workflow needs a target  This should tie to other linted rules.See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Required-Target

title: target-account-keys
message:
Path workflow,properties

All atomic actions should have their account key set to "Use Target's Default Account Keys". This allows the atomic to inherit whatever account key is associated with the target provided by the parent workflow. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Account-Keys

title: override-target-group-criteria
message:
Path actions,0

Should be "Use Workflow Target Group" or "Override Workflow Target Group Criteria". See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Override-Target-Group-Criteria

title: required-categories
message:
Path 

Every workflow needs at least 1 category. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Required-Categories/

title: required-workflow-key
message:
Path 

Every workflow needs a high level workflow key.  See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Required-Workflow-Key

title: all-actions-exist
message:
Path atomic_workflows,0

title: choose-matching-criteria
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

This should be "Choose first with matching critera" unless you want the workflow to execute once for each matching target in the group. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Choose-Matching-Criteria

title: target-selection-criteria
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

This is typically "Equals Case-Insensitive" but other operators are fine if you're doing something specific. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Selection-Criteria

title: use-default-target-group
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

We recommend using the "Default TargetGroup" since every SecureX orchestration tenant should have it by default. If you use your own target group, it will be created during workflow import. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Use-Default-Target-Group

title: cleanup-workflow
message:
Path workflow,properties,delete_workflow_instance

If you need additional target types for your workflow, the end user may need to add them to the target group configuration before running the workflow. title: no-custom-calenders
message:
Path calenders,0,unique_name

By default, the Default TargetGroup doesn't contain target types besides HTTP Endpoint and SMTP Endpoint. If you need additional target types for your workflow, the end user may need to add them to the target group configuration before running the workflow. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/No-Custom-Calenders

title: no-global-variables
message:
Path variables

Global variables should not be used in workflows or atomic actions meant to be shared. Instead, use a "Set Variables" activity to copy global variables to local variables within the workflow. Before exporting, simply remove the global variables so the other user can select their own. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/No-Global-Variables

title: secure-strings-have-default-values
message:
Path workflow,variables,1,properties,value

If a Secure String variable has a value when exported, it will prompt the user for its value during import. If you want to avoid this, clear the Secure String's value before exporting the workflow.  See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Secure-Strings-Have-Default-Values

title: target-account-keys
message:
Path workflow,properties,runtime_user,target_default

All atomic actions should have their account key set to "Use Target's Default Account Keys". This allows the atomic to inherit whatever account key is associated with the target provided by the parent workflow. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Account-Keys

title: choose-matching-criteria
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

This should be "Choose first with matching critera" unless you want the workflow to execute once for each matching target in the group. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Choose-Matching-Criteria

title: do-not-run-on-all-targets
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

We do not recommend checking "All Targets in this Group" as it limits your ability to define target selection criteria. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Do-Not-Run-On-All-Targets

title: execute-on-target-group
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

Workflows that are meant to be shared and require targets should use a Target Group. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Execute-On-Target-Group

title: target-selection-criteria
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

This is typically "Equals Case-Insensitive" but other operators are fine if you're doing something specific. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Selection-Criteria

title: target-specify-on-start
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

All atomic actions should have their target set to "Specify Target On Workflow Start". This allows the atomic to be more portable since the workflow using it can specify the target. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Specify-On-Start

title: use-default-target-group
message:
Path workflow,properties,target

We recommend using the "Default TargetGroup" since every SecureX orchestration tenant should have it by default. If you use your own target group, it will be created during workflow import. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Use-Default-Target-Group

title: target-account-keys
message:
Path workflow,properties

All atomic actions should have their account key set to "Use Target's Default Account Keys". This allows the atomic to inherit whatever account key is associated with the target provided by the parent workflow. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Account-Keys

title: use-workflow-target
message:
Path actions,0,properties,target

All activities in an atomic action that use a target should be set to "Use Workflow Target". See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Use-Workflow-Target

title: target-account-keys
message:
Path workflow,properties

All atomic actions should have their account key set to "Use Target's Default Account Keys". This allows the atomic to inherit whatever account key is associated with the target provided by the parent workflow. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Account-Keys
